plug something ↔ in.translation[0].defin: to connect a piece of electrical equipment to the main supply of electricity, or to another piece of electrical equipment
‘Is your printer working?’ ‘Wait a minute – it’s not plugged in.’
plug something ↔ in.translation[1].defin: able to be connected to the electricity supply, or to another piece of electrical equipment
plug something ↔ in.translation[2].defin: a piece of computer software that can be used in addition to existing software in order to make particular programs work properly
plug something ↔ in.translation[3].defin: to connect a piece of electrical equipment to the main supply of electricity, or to another piece of electrical equipment
plug something ↔ in.translation[4].defin: a piece of software that can be used in addition to existing software in order to make particular programs work properly
